title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Candytoy to invest ₹100 crore for expansion in Indore
items.summary:
- Candytoy will invest **₹100 crore** to build three new facilities in *Indore*, expanding over 500,000 sq ft to boost capacity.
- Expansion will create about 1,000 jobs and add products like *balloon toys*, *popping candy*, and *cotton candy*, plus export‑oriented toys tied to global festivals.
- This aims to position *Indore* as a global Candytoy hub and complements the new showroom, expanding export markets to Europe, the US, Africa, and the Gulf.

items.title: Rashmi Group to set up steel, power plant in West Bengal
items.summary:
- Rashmi Group will set up a *2.8 MTPA integrated steel plant* and a *400 MW captive power plant* at Purulia, West Bengal.
- The West Bengal government has allotted 938 acres of land for the projects, with proposed investments of *Rs 1,0000 crore* and the creation of *18,000 jobs*.
- The plan spans across *iron and steel*, *power*, *ferro alloys* and *mining*, aligning with the state's industrial development goals.

items.title: Indian automakers set for double-digit profit growth in Q2 after five-quarter lull: Report
India’s solar sector attracts $17.3 billion in corporate funding in Jan-Sept 2025: Report
MOL and SCI to expand green tugboat ops in India
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- MOL and SCI sign an MoU to expand tugboat services in India, aligning with the *Green Tug Transition Programme* to cut port emissions.
- MOL brings safe‑operations know‑how and alternative fuel tech to work with SCI’s network amid rising port activity and cargo growth.
- The initiative targets a 2040 shift to **green tugs**, signaling lasting gains in air quality and port efficiency.

items.title: Nithia Capital buys Topworth Urja for ₹300 cr to grow steel
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- **Nithia Capital** completes the acquisition of **Topworth Urja and Metals** for **₹300 crore** to expand steel capacity, marking its third steel-asset buy in India. 
- Urja near Nagpur operates a 0.2 mtpa long-products plant with DRI, steelmaking, rolling and 35 MW captive power; **Nithia** plans to rehabilitate and expand to 0.5 mtpa and maximize power generation. 
- The group targets exceeding **6 mtpa** steel capacity in India as it leverages the deal to bolster its portfolio, with leaders citing the **IBC** framework's role.

items.title: Kranti signs MoU with Universal Autofoundry
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Kranti Industries and **Universal Autofoundry** signed a **MoU** to establish a long-term **machining alliance** in **Rajasthan**, integrating foundry and machining into a unified manufacturing setup serving the automotive and engineering sectors. 
- Under the agreement, **Universal Autofoundry** will lease its machining premises at **Sargoth** in **Sikar district** and consolidate its machine shops at **Unit 3**, with **Kranti** operating exclusively for casting components manufactured by Universal. 
- The collaboration marks Kranti’s entry into **northern India**, expanding beyond its western base to improve **logistics**, **quality**, and **delivery timelines** through shared infrastructure.

items.title: Harman invests ₹345 crore to expand Pune automotive manufacturing plant
Trump strikes deals on trade, critical minerals in Southeast Asia
Exosens increases capacity expansion plans amid strong revenue growth
items.summary:
- Exosens will increase *global capacity* by 40% by 2027 with an additional **€17 million** investment in *Europe*, up from the 25% expansion previously announced. 
- Revenue rose **€327.8 million** in the first nine months of 2025, up 23.2%, driven by **Amplification** (+21%) and **Detection & Imaging** (+26%). 
- CEO Jerome Cerisier said the company will implement an **additional staggered capacity expansion** to meet sustained demand and reaffirm full-year guidance.

items.title: Candytoy to invest ₹100 cr for 3 new units
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Candytoy plans *₹100 cr* investment to add three facilities in *Indore*, MP.
- Projects 500,000 sq ft and will create roughly *1,000* jobs in the region.
- Director Gaurav Mirchandani says Indore will be a global hub for Candytoy; the firm had a prior *₹110 cr* Series A.

items.title: Shree Cement commissions 20-MW solar plant in Uttar Pradesh
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- Shree Cement commissioned a **20 MW solar power plant** in *Chitrakoot district*, *Uttar Pradesh*, with Phase-I commercially operational and Phase-II due by end of Q4 FY26.
- The plant will supply renewable energy to the Etah grinding unit via the *Wheeling and Banking route* and is expected to offset about **22,000 metric tonnes of CO2** annually.
- Once fully online, the company’s installed solar capacity rises to **313.5 MW**, and the project is projected to create **30-40 daily** local jobs for the community.

items.title: Goldman Sachs: India's defense market set to grow
items.summary:
- Goldman Sachs notes an expanding *Total Addressable Market (TAM)* for India's defense sector, with AoNs totalling **₹2.5 trillion** in FY26, up from FY25.
- DAC approvals worth **₹790 billion** across the Navy, Army, and Air Force reinforce government focus and rising defense spending.
- They expect benefits to **trickle down** to the *private sector*, sustaining **earnings momentum** and signaling *long-term* defense-market growth.

items.title: India faces challenges in local rare earth production amidst China's export restrictions
50 MW Kudankulam draw approved for Units 3 and 4
items.summary:
- *CEA* approved a **50 MW** draw from Kudankulam Unit 1 to support start-up and commissioning of *Units 3 and 4*, effective Oct 19, 2025. 
- CSAT energised; SRLDC will schedule the draw, with peak start-up demand seen at **60 MW** by Dec 2025 and **65 MW** by Jan 2026 as Units 3 and 4 progress. 
- Tamil Nadu has sought full allocation of the 2,000 MW from Units 3 and 4; Centre decision is pending.

items.title: Singapore expands land for green energy and data centres
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- About 300 hectares on *Jurong Island*'s western side will be set aside for *renewable energy projects* and *low-carbon fuel production*.
- Separately, 20 hectares will become Singapore's largest *data centre park*, designed to support up to *700 MW* of power, tapping into the island's energy ecosystem.
- The plan aims to make *Jurong Island* a global test-bed for new energies and *low-carbon technologies*, including *solar*, *sustainable aviation fuel*, *low-carbon ammonia*, and *hydrogen-ready* plants.

items.title: Telangana eyes 19,000 MW demand as Yadadri nears
items.summary:
- *Yadadri thermal power station* is set to come online in phases, lifting Telangana's capacity to meet projected 19,000 MW demand. 
- Authorities have ordered grid upgrades, including new sub-stations, transformers, and **SCADA-like** monitoring to ensure reliable supply through summer and rabi. 
- Coal supply will be ramped up by *Singareni Collieries Company Ltd* from 1.80 lakh to 2.20 lakh tonnes per day by November to back the generation push.

items.title: Indian automakers gear up for SA manufacturing expansion
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- South Africa is inviting Indian and Chinese automakers to upgrade lines to **CKD** and expand local production for stronger exports.
- **Mahindra & Mahindra** plans to upgrade from SKD to CKD and explore **EV** assembly in Durban, backed by policy support for clean mobility.
- Tata Motors is re-entering via a Motus partnership, while talks with Toyota and Ford aim to sustain production amid tariff risks and rising competition.

items.title: Low-end smartphones may get costlier as chipmakers shift focus to AI servers
iPhone boom lifts India's electronics exports
items.author: Kiran Rathee, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Electronics exports* could overtake *petroleum* to become India's second-largest category, aided by curbs on *Russian oil*.
- *In H1 FY26,* *electronics* rose 42% to $22.2B, with about half from *Apple iPhones*, making it the fastest-growing sector.
- Over three years, *exports* jumped 63% while *petroleum* declined and *engineering* led the top categories.

items.title: Empowering women engineers to thrive in India’s manufacturing sector
Significant percentage of manufacturing leadership appointments were external hires: Report
IMF: India's growth driven by domestic demand
items.summary:
- IMF's World Economic Outlook projects India to remain the fastest-growing major economy, with about 6.6% growth in 2026.
- Growth is anchored by three drivers: rising *domestic consumption*, a revival in *manufacturing*, and strong performance in *services*.
- Analysts urge translating this momentum into inclusive gains—more jobs, poverty reduction, and investments in infrastructure, education, and health.

items.title: JSW Energy looks to operationalise 5 GWh battery assembly unit in Pune in 3rd quarter
AlchoBev industry expects up to 20% growth in Dec quarter riding on bullish festive sales
The next frontier: Turning tier-2 and tier-3 cities into leadership powerhouses
India to host first Asia-Pacific aircraft investigation meet
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- India will host the *APAC-AIG* meeting for the first time (28–31 Oct 2025) with a four‑day program.
- The event is organised by the *Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB)* on behalf of the Ministry of Civil Aviation and will be inaugurated by Union Civil Aviation Minister *Rammohan Naidu*.
- Around 90 representatives from *ICAO*, member states, and regional accident investigation authorities are expected to participate to strengthen cooperation and *aviation safety*.

items.title: From coal to green hydrogen: Odisha clears ₹1.46 lakh cr energy projects
India to develop advanced chipsets, boost semiconductor mission with ₹200 cr investment: Ashwini Vaishnaw
Odisha approves multi-crore 'B-MAAN' scheme to boost aviation sector
How India’s steel market is shifting from raw steel to customised products
Ban imposed on making, purchase of carbide guns in Indore
Kwatra meets Lockheed CEO on India-US ties
items.summary:
- *Vinay Mohan Kwatra* met *Jim Taiclet*, CEO of **Lockheed Martin**, to discuss **India-US industrial cooperation** under the *Atmanirbhar Bharat goals*. 
- Partnerships such as the **C-130J Super Hercules** and **MH-60 Romeo** showcase deepening defense-industrial links and India’s Make in India initiatives. 
- Kwatra’s X post described the meeting as productive and signaled a commitment to strengthen defense ties between **India** and the **U.S.**.

items.title: Foxconn unit to ramp AirPods output in Telangana
items.summary: - Foxconn's Hyderabad unit in **Telangana** will ramp **AirPods** production, expanding staff from about 2,000 to 5,000 and lifting monthly output toward 200,000 **AirPods**.\n- It redeploys machinery from **Vietnam** as part of a shift away from **China**, with total investment around ₹4,800 crore (over ₹3,000 crore already deployed).\n- The move ties into **Apple**'s push to manufacture in **India**, helping create a more resilient supply chain after earlier dysprosium shortages and export curbs.

items.title: China asks US chip firms for customer data
items.summary:
- *China's fair-trade bureau* asks US chip companies to reveal names of Chinese customers, transaction details including sales volumes and logistics-to-warehousing costs, and information on raw-material suppliers. 
- *US firms* will have 37 days to submit their responses. 
- This move comes amid broader US-China tech restrictions, export controls, and ongoing antitrust probes into Qualcomm and Nvidia.

items.title: India pushes e-waste recycling to recover critical minerals
items.summary:
- The Ministry of Mines is pushing India's e-waste recycling program to recover *critical minerals* such as *lithium*, *cobalt*, and *nickel*. 
- An incentive scheme worth **Rs 1,500 crore** was approved to promote recycling under the **National Critical Mineral Mission**. 
- Feedstock will include e-waste and used LIBs, formalized through **Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR)**, with *hydrometallurgy* and *indigenous techniques* advancing mineral recovery.

items.title: Brussels to host EU-China talks on rare earth export controls
items.summary:
- Brussels will host **in-person** and *virtual* talks with Chinese officials on export controls amid tensions over *rare-earth* trade.
- A two-hour video call between EU Trade Commissioner Maros Sefcovic and Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao set the stage for talks in **Brussels**.
- China accounts for around 90% of global processed *rare earths*; 12 of 17 rare earths have export restrictions, and only about half of EU export licences have been processed.

items.title: China lithium hits two-month high as demand rises
items.summary:
- *Lithium carbonate futures* in China rose on improving demand from the **EV** and energy-storage sectors.
- Falling lithium stocks supported the move, with prices around 80,000 yuan per metric ton.
- Analysts warn the rally could be unsustainable amid oversupply and rapid capacity expansion.

items.title: UAE signs $1.8 billion deal with US firm to boost global critical minerals supply
Safran lifts forecast after strong Q3
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- **Safran** lifts its full-year revenue growth forecast to *11–13%* after a strong third quarter, led by its jet-engine division.
- Q3 revenue rose *18.3%* to *€7.85 billion*, with propulsion up *25.6%* and services up *21.1%*, aided by LEAP shipments.
- It also raised targets for operating income to *€5.1–5.2 billion* and free cash flow to *€3.5–3.7 billion*, with LEAP deliveries expected to grow by more than *20%*.

items.title: Xiaomi cites memory-chip price rise hitting smartphone costs
items.summary:
- *Xiaomi* says surging *memory-chip* prices have raised smartphone production costs.
- The *Redmi K90* base price is 2,599 yuan (12 GB/256 GB), up from the K80's 2,499 yuan, with a temporary 300-yuan cut on the 12/512 model.
- A global rush for *AI chips* is tightening supply and boosting *NAND/DRAM* costs, lifting profits for *Samsung* and *SK Hynix*.

items.title: Chinese phone makers expand India operations despite thin margins
Colab Platforms to enter semiconductor OSAT sector
items.summary:
- Colab Platforms will form Colab Semiconductor Pvt Ltd to enter India's *semiconductor manufacturing* and *OSAT* markets, expanding beyond its AI, blockchain, e-sports, fintech, and drones ventures.
- The move aligns with India's forecasted growth in the sector from USD 52B in 2024-25 to USD 108B by 2030, a *15% CAGR*, per MD Puneet Singh.
- The expansion is expected to unlock multi-decade growth, strengthen India's tech sovereignty, and create enterprise value as the ecosystem evolves, following the launch of Colab Intelligence Private Limited for AI operations.

items.title: NTPC, EIL sign coal-to-gas facility deal
items.summary:
- NTPC and **EIL** signed an agreement to develop a coal-to-SNG facility to enable flexible power generation.
- The facility will use *high-ash domestic coal* from NTPC's captive mines to fuel gas-based power stations and in-situ generation.
- NTPC's R&D arm will lead the initiative under *Greening the Coal*, emphasising **cleaner coal technologies** and energy diversification.

items.title: Reliance races to get battery gear orders out of China ahead of export curbs
SISA, BMS unveil CoE to boost future-ready talent
items.summary:
- BMSIT&M and SISA launch a Centre of Excellence to train *future-ready talent* in cybersecurity and emerging tech.
- The CoE bridges academia and industry, helping students tackle *AI* and *quantum*-driven threats with a focus on *prediction and preparedness*.
- The initiative aims to empower engineers to anticipate evolving threats, supporting India’s digital future and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*.
keywords: BMS Institute of Technology and Management

items.title: Turkiye in talks with Qatar, Oman to buy Eurofighter jets
items.summary:
- Turkiye is in talks with Qatar and Oman to buy *Eurofighter Typhoon* jets as a stopgap ahead of **KAAN**'s readiness.
- *Erdogan* said talks are progressing positively during a Gulf tour with no details released.
- The plan foresees a transitional fleet: 40 *Eurofighter Typhoon* jets, 40 *F-16s* and 40 *F-35s*, until **KAAN** enters service around 2028.

items.title: GX Group to invest ₹500 cr to set up photonics modules
items.summary:
- **GX Group** to invest ₹500 crore to set up photonics modules and a chip arm in India via GX Quantum Photonics Pvt Ltd, with manufacturing in Bhiwadi and R&D expansion in Chennai.
- The venture will produce about *3 million chips annually*, create 300+ direct jobs, and begin operations by *Q1 FY27* with domestic priority and potential international forays (US/Europe).
- It collaborates with *SMART Photonics* for InP-based PICs, focuses on **Photonics modules** for **5G/6G** and quantum communications, and targets a ~*USD 50 billion* addressable market in India.

items.title: Premier Energies to acquire KSolare Energy for ₹170 cr
items.summary:
- Premier Energies will acquire the entire ownership of *KSolare Energy*, forming a 51:49 JV with *Syrma SGS Technology* for ₹170 crore. 
- *KSolare Energy* runs a Pune manufacturing facility producing solar inverters (on-grid, off-grid, and hybrid) with a capacity of 500,000 units per year for the residential market. 
- The JV plans a brownfield expansion in Pune to scale up to 1 million inverters annually and expand in the domestic rooftop solar segment under government schemes like PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana.
keywords: PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana

items.title: AI demand lifts Taiwan industrial output in Sept
items.summary:
- Taiwan's total industrial production rose 15.48% YoY in September, with the manufacturing index at a record high, driven by *AI demand*. 
- In the information and electronics sector, output surged as *AI* and high‑performance computing boosted demand, with ICs and electronics products up over 26%. 
- Some traditional industries were pressured by weak global demand, with auto parts and base metals down.
